require.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and version constraints (values) that are required to run this package.

archive.description: Options for creating package archives for distribution.

directory.description: The location of the dist files.

absolute-directory.description: The absolute path of the dist files.

skip-dev.description: If true, will not create downloads for branches.

checksum.description: If false, will not provide the sha1 checksum for the dist files.

ignore-filters.description: Ignore filters when looking for files in the package.

override-dist-type.description: If true, archive format will be used to substitute dist type when generating archive file name.

rearchive.description: Create new archives for packages with a tar or zip dist, defaults to true

repositories.description: A set of additional repositories where packages can be found.

repositories-dep.description: A set of additional repositories where packages for dependencies can be found.

minimum-stability.description: The minimum stability the packages must have to be install-able. Possible values are: dev, alpha, beta, RC, stable.

minimum-stability-per-package.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and minimum stability (values).

additionalProperties.description: The minimum stability the package must have to be install-able. Possible values are: dev, alpha, beta, RC, stable. This overrides the "minimum-stability" global option for the specified package.

abandoned.description: List of packages marked as abandoned for this repository, the mark can be boolean or a package name/URL pointing to a recommended alternative.

blacklist.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and version constraints (values) to exclude after selecting packages.

include-types.description: An array of composer types. When an array is provided only packages with this type will be selected by Satis.

exclude-types.description: An array of composer types. Any packages with a type in this array will not be selected by Satis.

require-all.description: If true, selects all versions of all packages in the repositories defined.

require-dependencies.description: If true, resolve and add all dependencies of each required package.

require-dev-dependencies.description: If true, resolve and add all Dev dependencies of each required package.

only-dependencies.description: If true, will not require the root dependencies only their dependencies.

only-best-candidates.description: If true, will attempt to resolve a minimum number of candidates for each dependency.

require-dependency-filter.description: If false, will include all versions matching a dependency.

strip-hosts.description: List of domains, IPs, CIDR notations, '/local' (=localnet and other reserved) or '/private' (=private IPs) to be stripped from the output. If set and non-false, local file paths are removed too.

include-filename.description: Specify filename instead of default include/all$%hash%.json

available-package-patterns.description: Composer v2 feature. List of patterns like 'vendor/*' for packages available, recommended with many packages. If not set, 'available-packages' will be set with ALL package names.

output-dir.description: The directory where the static Repository is built.

output-html.description: If true, build a static web page.

providers-history-size.description: Optional integer to be used for keeping a number of files that would otherwise be pruned.

twig-template.description: Path to a template for the static web page.

allow-seo-indexing.description: Allow the generated web view to be indexed by search engines

process-timeout.description: The timeout in seconds for process executions, defaults to 300 (5mins).

use-include-path.description: If true, the Composer autoloader will also look for classes in the PHP include path.

preferred-install.description: The install method Composer will prefer to use, defaults to auto and can be any of source, dist or auto.

notify-on-install.description: Composer allows repositories to define a notification URL, so that they get notified whenever a package from that repository is installed. This option allows you to disable that behaviour, defaults to true.

github-protocols.description: A list of protocols to use for github.com clones, in priority order, defaults to ["git", "https", "http"].

github-oauth.description: A hash of domain name => github API oauth tokens, typically {"github.com":"<token>"}.

gitlab-token.description: A hash of domain name => gitlab API tokens, typically {"gitlab.com":"<token>"}.

store-auths.description: What to do after prompting for authentication, one of: true (store), false (do not store) or "prompt" (ask every time), defaults to prompt.

platform.description: This is a hash of package name (keys) and version (values) that will be used to mock the platform packages on this machine.

vendor-dir.description: The location where all packages are installed, defaults to "vendor".

bin-dir.description: The location where all binaries are linked, defaults to "vendor/bin".

cache-dir.description: The location where all caches are located, defaults to "~/.composer/cache" on *nix and "%LOCALAPPDATA%\Composer" on windows.

cache-files-dir.description: The location where files (zip downloads) are cached, defaults to "{$cache-dir}/files".

cache-repo-dir.description: The location where repo (git/hg repo clones) are cached, defaults to "{$cache-dir}/repo".

cache-vcs-dir.description: The location where vcs info (git clones, github api calls, etc. when reading vcs repos) are cached, defaults to "{$cache-dir}/vcs".

cache-ttl.description: The default cache time-to-live, defaults to 15552000 (6 months).

cache-files-ttl.description: The cache time-to-live for files, defaults to the value of cache-ttl.

cache-files-maxsize.description: The cache max size for the files cache, defaults to "300MiB".

bin-compat.description: The compatibility of the binaries, defaults to "auto" (automatically guessed) and can be "full" (compatible with both Windows and Unix-based systems).

discard-changes.description: The default style of handling dirty updates, defaults to false and can be any of true, false or "stash".

autoloader-suffix.description: Optional string to be used as a suffix for the generated Composer autoloader. When null a random one will be generated.

optimize-autoloader.description: Always optimize when dumping the autoloader.

prepend-autoloader.description: If false, the composer autoloader will not be prepended to existing autoloaders, defaults to true.

classmap-authoritative.description: If true, the composer autoloader will not scan the filesystem for classes that are not found in the class map, defaults to false.

github-domains.description: A list of domains to use in github mode. This is used for GitHub Enterprise setups, defaults to ["github.com"].

github-expose-hostname.description: Defaults to true. If set to false, the OAuth tokens created to access the github API will have a date instead of the machine hostname.

notify-batch.description: a URL that will be called every time a user installs a package.

_comment.description: A key to store comments in

pretty-print.description: Defaults to true. When false, the JSON_PRETTY_PRINT option will not be used on encoding.
